Miles Sound System SDK 6.6h

AIL_allocate_3D_sample_handle

The function AIL_allocate_3D_sample_handle allocates a handle that can play 3D audio.

H3DSAMPLE AIL_allocate_3D_sample_handle(
  HPROVIDER m3d
);

In Parameters

m3d
indicates the M3D provider to allocate the 3D sample from.

Returns

A non-zero H3DSAMPLE handle, if successful, zero if unsuccessful.

Discussion

Most of the providers have a limited number of H3DSAMPLES that can be loaded, so you should be prepared to handle this function failing (by stopping lower-priority sample handles, or by allocating a sample handle from an alternate M3D provider, for example).

This function simply allocates a handle. You cannot play a sample until you load it into the handle with AIL_set_3D_sample_file.

Note that on Xbox, you don't have to allocate 3D handles specifically. You can just open normal HSAMPLE handles with AIL_allocate_sample_handle and use them for all 3D operations. The 2D and 3D systems are integrated. Example files that use this function: EXAM3D.C


Group: 3D Digital Audio Services
Related Functions: AIL_allocate_sample_handle, AIL_release_3D_sample_handle, AIL_set_3D_sample_file, AIL_set_3D_sample_info
Related Basic Types: H3DPOBJECT, H3DSAMPLE, HPROVIDER
Related FAQs: How do I play a 3D digital sound?
